title: Post-Covid, Procurement Still Under-Resourced
summary: Procurement departments are struggling with digital transformation due to insufficient funding and resources. While some companies are investing heavily in procurement technology, others are hampered by manual processes and a lack of clarity on the business case for AI applications. Generative AI is seen as a potential solution for automating tasks and providing valuable insights, but procurement professionals face challenges in convincing stakeholders to invest in new technologies and navigating resource constraints.

title: Alarms will be sounding at Qantas, but not in the cockpit
summary: Qantas, Australia's national airline, has experienced a significant decline in its ranking in the Skytrax World Airline Awards, dropping from 5th in 2022 to 24th in 2023. This decline coincides with a series of negative news stories surrounding the airline, including accusations of prioritizing corporate profits over customer and staff well-being. The article suggests that the airline needs to address these issues and improve its customer service to regain its former standing.

title: Industrial Software Market worth $46.6 billion by 2029 - Exclusive Report by MarketsandMarkets
summary: The global industrial software market is projected to grow significantly, driven by the adoption of Industry 4.0 technologies and the need for increased efficiency and agility in manufacturing.  This software helps to optimize production processes, ensure compliance with quality standards, and accelerate time-to-market for new products, particularly in the automotive and pharmaceuticals industries.  The Asia Pacific region is expected to be a key growth area for this market.

title: Alarms will be sounding at Qantas. Not in the cockpit, in the boardroom
summary: Qantas, Australia's national carrier, has seen a significant decline in its ranking in the Skytrax World Airline Awards, dropping from 5th in 2022 to 24th in 2023. This decline follows a string of negative news stories, including illegal sackings of ground crew and selling tickets for nonexistent flights, leading to criticism of the airline's management prioritizing profits over customer and staff interests.
